main_definition: A session refers to a period of time during which activities take place, typically in the context of meetings, discussions, or computer-based interactions.

meanings_and_examples.example: The marketing team had their weekly session to discuss new strategies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Time allocated for study, work, or a specific activity
meanings_and_examples.example: She has three sessions of calculus class every Monday and Wednesday evening.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Period of time spent using software applications like web browsers
meanings_and_examples.example: The computer session lasted for two hours while the user worked on a project.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group therapy or counseling session
meanings_and_examples.example: He attends weekly sessions with his psychologist to address personal issues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Period for performing a task or process, such as in computing or legislative bodies
meanings_and_examples.example: The committee will hold multiple public sessions before voting on the new bill.
